bibl.title: Despatch from John H. Smyth to Robert R. Hitt
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, La, Sept. 30, 1881.

Mr. J. H. Smyth to the
Assistant Secretary.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, La, Sept. 30, 1881.
I have the honor respectfully to forward the within quarterly returns for the quarter ending September 30th, 1881.

In the June returns and accounts, I advised the Department that the dues of the bark, Mary Celeste of Boston, which arrived June 5th, 1881, had not been paid. Said bark returned to this port during the present quarter, paid all fees, and departed Sept. 17, 1881. Please have said fees, $6.83, credited to June quarter.

You will pleased find enclosed–accounts for Fifth Auditor, with returns as follows: letters and despatches received, No. 1; letters sent, No. 2; arrival and departure of American
Hon. R. R. Hitt,
Assistant Secretary,
Washington, D.C.
American vessels, No. 3; digest of invoice book, No. 4.

I am, Sir,
Your obd't serv't,
Jno. H. Smyth, U.S.
Consul General

1. Letters and despatches received.
2. Letters sent.
3. Arrival and departure of American vessels.
4. Digest of the Invoice book.
